quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Artist
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, dubois, star. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If My Nose Were Full of Nickels (Id Blow It All On You) was written and performed by this joke telling artist and his band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis Warner

questions.question: Im So Miserable Without You, Its Almost Like Youre Here was written and performed by this artist whose claim to fame is his daughter Miley and another song Achy Breaky Heart. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billy Ray Cyrus

questions.question: Which character from the book Les Miserables was left out of the musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Azelma

questions.question: This person was part of a group that recorded Its Hard to Kiss the Lips at Night That Chew Your Ass Out All Day Long. The super group, The Notorious Cherry Bombs, recorded an album called, funny enough, The Notorious Cherry Bombs. What country star, whos no fish out of water, was part of this group?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vince Gill

questions.question: Get Your Tongue Outta My Mouth Cause Im Kissing You Good-bye is a song by an artist who also became known for Ahab, the Arab and Harry, the Hairy Ape. He also won a Grammy for Everything is Beautiful. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Stevens

questions.question: Billy Broke My Heart at Walgreens (and Then I Cried All the Way to Sears) is a song by the daughter of Kitty Wells and singer/bandleader Johnnie Wright. Not much is known about this lady since her songs never quite made a hit with the public. Who is she?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruby Wright

questions.question: What song won the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1980?

options.text: I Will Survive by Gloria Gaynor
You Dont Bring Me Flowers by Barbra Streisand and Neil Diamond
What a Fool Believes by The Doobie Brothers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: What a Fool Believes by The Doobie Brothers

questions.question: What Broadway star appearing in Sondheims Company also played a character on the TV sitcom, Alice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beth Howland (Alice character Vera)

questions.question: If Fingerprints Showed Up on Skin (I Wonder Whose Id Find on You) is one of the songs on his album Easy Loving. In 1972 he won a Grammy as Best Country Male Vocalist and the Country Music Association award for song of the year which was Easy Loving. Who is this man whose name reminds you of something everybody has?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Freddie Hart

questions.question: Get Your Biscuits in the Oven and Your Buns in the Bed was released in 1973 on an album entitled Sold American. Another rather controversial song on this album is We Reserve the Right to Refuse Service to You. The artist calls himself a Texas Jewboy and tends to think of his humor along the lines of Mark Twain and Will Rogers. Just who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kinky Friedman

questions.question: This song won the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1981.

options.text: Theme from New York, New York by Frank Sinatra
Woman in Love by Barbra Streisand

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sailing by Christopher Cross

questions.question: Thanks to the Cathouse (Im In the Doghouse With You) was recorded on an album by this artist whose most famous song is Take This Job and Shove It. He also sang Im the Only Hell (Mama Ever Raised). Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Paycheck

questions.question: In the musical version of Grey Gardens, Act 1 centers around the fictitious engagement of Little Edie Beale to what political figure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Kennedy Jr.

questions.question: She Got the Goldmine (I Got the Shaft) was written by Tim DuBois but made popular by this co-star of Smokey and the Bandit who played Cledus Snow and sang the theme song East Bound and Down. What is his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Reed

questions.question: Although his most famous song is Margaritaville one cannot forget another memorable song of his called My Head Hurts, My Feet Stink, and I Dont Love Jesus. If youre a member of his tropical bird group then you know his name. What is it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Buffett

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Record
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, jam, music. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This song received the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1986.

options.text: Born in the U.S.A. by Bruce Springsteen
Money for Nothing by Dire Straits
The Power of Love by Huey Lewis and the News
We Are the World by USA for Africa

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We Are the World by USA for Africa

questions.question: Who won the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1982?

options.text: Diana Ross and Lionel Richie for Endless Love
Christopher Cross for Arthurs Theme (Best That You Can Do)
Kim Carnes for Bette Davis Eyes
John Lennon for (Just Like) Starting Over

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kim Carnes for Bette Davis Eyes

questions.question: What song received the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1988?

options.text: I Still Havent Found What Im Looking For by U2

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Graceland by Paul Simon

questions.question: Who was the winner of the 1987 Grammy Award for Record of the Year?

options.text: Robert Palmer for Addicted to Love
Whitney Houston for Greatest Love of All

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Winwood for Higher Love

questions.question: What was the name of the band Eddie Vedder left in 1990 before becoming the lead singer of Pearl Jam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad Radio

questions.question: Which Pearl Jam classic song from the 1991 album Ten is about homelessness?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Evenflow

questions.question: Pearl Jams 2003 album Lost Dogs is a compilation of songs that had been cut from previous albums. Despite not being released, many of the songs became fan favorites at live shows. Which of these songs from Lost Dogs did Pearl Jam never play live in the period 1992-2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hitchhiker

questions.question: What artist won the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1985?

options.text: Tina Turner for Whats Love Got to Do with It
Cyndi Lauper for Girls Just Want to Have Fun
Chicago for Hard Habit to Break
Bruce Springsteen for Dancing in the Dark

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tina Turner for Whats Love Got to Do with It

questions.question: The 1998 holiday CD by Pearl Jam contained the soon-to-be-popular song Last Kiss. What was the other song on the CD?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soldier of Love

questions.question: Which song from Pearl Jams 2000 album Binaural was written while reflecting on the Columbine High School shootings in 1999?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rival

questions.question: Who was the winner of the 1984 Grammy Award for Record of the Year?

options.text: Every Breath You Take by The Police
Flashdance... What a Feeling by Irene Cara

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beat It by Michael Jackson

questions.question: The Pearl Jam song Down, which was released on the 2003 B-sides compilation Lost Dogs, was inspired by the writings of what author?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Howard Zinn

questions.question: Who was the drummer on Pearl Jams debut album Ten (1991)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Krusen

questions.question: What song received the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1983?

options.text: Ebony and Ivory by Paul McCartney and Stevie Wonder
Always on My Mind by Willie Nelson

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rosanna by Toto

questions.question: Who won the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1989?

options.text: Dont Worry, Be Happy by Bobby McFerrin
Man in the Mirror by Michael Jackson
Giving You the Best That I Got by Anita Baker

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dont Worry, Be Happy by Bobby McFerrin

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Apocalyptica
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This group has the same name as a famous figure in history .  They sang the song They Are Coming to Take Me Away, Haa Haa.

questions.question: David Seville  the Chipmunks sang this bird song in 1958.

questions.question: What was the title of Apocalypticas first album?

options.text: Metal Mayhem by the Four Cellos

questions.question: In what year was Apocalyptica formed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1995

questions.question: Cult and Reflections are the names of Apocalypticas third and fourth albums respectively.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The song Vehicle was sung by this crazy-named group.

questions.question: Which of these is a name of a song?

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Chris Brown and Song

questions.question: The members of U2 have never considered breaking up the band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia

Stomp the Yard and This Christmas
Step and What Happened On Christmas

questions.question: How old was Chris Brown when he got his first tattoo?

questions.question: Which of these lines contains artist all of which have at least one song featuring Chris Brown?

Bow Wow, Lil Mama, Jordin Sparks, Rihanna
Bow Wow, Omarion, Lil Mama, Lil Wayne

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, butler, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name Phil Collins famous paradise song from 1989.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Another Day in Paradise

questions.question: What is the title of the popular song from the 1953 musical Kismet that has been covered by many musicians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stranger in Paradise

questions.question: Name the Paul Brady song covered by Tina Turner in 1987.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paradise Is Here

questions.question: Which of these is the title of a song released by Phil Collins in 1990?

options.text: I Found Something on the Way to Heaven
I Saw Something on the Way to Heaven
Something Happened on the Way to Heaven
There Was Something on the Way to Heaven

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Something Happened on the Way to Heaven

questions.question: Two of the members of short-lived indie band The Jennifers later formed this famous alternative group.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Supergrass

questions.question: The acclaimed alternative rock guitarist Burnard Butler was a member of which indie band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Suede

questions.question: Which one of these alternative bands is not from Manchester, England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jesus and Mary Chain

questions.question: What was the first single released by Oasis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Supersonic

questions.question: What band recorded the 1979 song Highway to Hell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: AC/DC

questions.question: Is it true that Ian Brown was the lead singer of the Stone Roses and later became a solo artist?

questions.question: Before the formation of New Order Bernard Sumner, Peter Hook and Steven Morris were members of this band.

questions.question: Which of the following artists perormed the 1979 song Bat Out of Hell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Meat Loaf

questions.question: Blur were an important part of the alternative music scene in England in the 90ties.Unlike many alternative bands that remain obscure they also enjoyed considerable commercial success. Girls  Boys was the opening track of which of their albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parklife

questions.question: Who recorded the 1992 song Thought Id Died and Gone to Heaven?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bryan Adams
